qas.question: When was the Royal College of Chemistry established?
Which politicians donated funds to establish the Royal College of Chemistry?

answers.text: Benjamin Disraeli, William Gladstone and Robert Peel

qas.question: Who was the first professor of the Royal College of Chemistry?
Why was the Royal College of Chemistry founded?

answers.text: in the United Kingdom the teaching of chemistry in particular had fallen behind that in Germany

qas.question: Who supported the Royal College of Chemistry?
When was the Royal College of Chemistry established?
What was not well taught that led to the founding of the Royal College of Chemistry?

answers.text: practical aspects of the experimental sciences

qas.question: Which country was ahead of the United Kingdom in the teaching of chemistry?
Which Prince supported the establishment of the college?
Who was the first professor of the college?
What college was established by private donations in 1845?
What subject was Germany behind the UK in teaching?
Who appealed for public funding of the college?
Who requested to be the first professor?

context: <b10_0>The Royal College of Chemistry<b10_0/> was established by private subscription in <a0_0><a5_0>1845<a5_0/><a0_0/> as there was a growing awareness that <a6_0>practical aspects of the experimental sciences<a6_0/> were not well taught and that <a3_0>in the United Kingdom the teaching of <b11_0>chemistry<b11_0/> in particular had fallen behind that in <a7_0>Germany<a7_0/><a3_0/>. As a result of a movement earlier in the decade, many <b12_0>politicians<b12_0/> donated funds to establish the college, including <a1_0>Benjamin Disraeli, William Gladstone and Robert Peel<a1_0/>. It was also supported by <a4_0><a8_0>Prince Albert<a8_0/><a4_0/>, who persuaded <a2_0><a9_0>August <b13_0>Wilhelm von Hofmann<b13_0/><a9_0/><a2_0/> to be the first professor.
